org.jetel.data

Class InternalSortDataRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.InternalSortDataRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISortDataRecord

    public class InternalSortDataRecord
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISortDataRecord
    Class for simple in-memory sorting of data records.
    Incoming records are stored in in-memory buffer(s). Buffers are allocated on the fly with increasing capacity up to defined limit.
    When storing phase is finished, sort method sorts the records in ascending order(java.util.Arrays.sort method is used).
    After sorting is finished, reading can start. If descending order is specified, the records returned by get() method are in descending order.
    Standard way of working with SortDataRecordInternal:
    1. put() n-times
    2. sort()
    3. get() n-times
    See Also:
    RecordKey

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all counters and empties internal buffers. The sorting (feeding) can then be restarted. Existing pre-allocated buffers/collections will be reused.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ISortDataRecord

      • put

        public boolean put(DataRecord record)
        Description copied from interface: ISortDataRecord
        Stores additional record into internal buffer for sorting. Implementors are sorters, which can be based on various algorithm. According to this interface, they must hold to this pattern: User calls: get() n-times sort() put() n-times User receives DataRecord items one by one by calling put() in sorted order.
        Specified by:
        put in interface ISortDataRecord
        Parameters:
        record - DataRecord to be stored

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Description copied from interface: ISortDataRecord
        Sorts internal array and flush it to disk, thus reading can start Note: in the case of external sorting, when merge is necessary, other name would be suitable, it is named sort() to maintain consistency with InternalSortDataRecord
        Specified by:
        sort in interface ISortDataRecord

      • setUseCollator

        @Deprecated
public void setUseCollator(boolean useCollator)
        Deprecated. 
        Determines whether Collator will be used for sorting Strings.
        Without Collator, strings are sorted based on individual characters unicode. With Collator, locale-sensitive String comparison is performed.
        Parameters:
        useCollator - the useCollator to set

      • setCollatorLocale

        @Deprecated
public void setCollatorLocale(java.util.Locale collatorLocale)
        Deprecated. 
        Set which Locale (national peculiarities) will be used when comparing Strings.
        For example, in Czech "ch" is a one character and "a","??" both precede "b".
        Parameters:
        collatorLocale - the collatorLocale to set
